precedents.citation: Century Spinning and Manufacturing Company Ltd. and another v. The Ulhasnagar Municipal Council and another 1

anchor.surface_text: Century Spinning and Manufacturing Company Ltd. and another v. The Ulhasnagar Municipal Council and another 1  in support of his companytention that the High Court was number justified in dismissing the writ petition summarily. It is numberdoubt true that in the above decision it has been held that though the High Court has a discretion to decline to exercise its extra-ordinary jurisdiction under Art. 226, nevertheless, the discretion is to be judicially exercised and if the petitioner makes a claim which is frivolous, vexatious or prima facie unjust, the High Court may decline to entertain the petition.

precedents.case_name: Century Spinning and Manufacturing Company Ltd. v. Ulhasnagar Municipal Council
precedents.cited_proposition: High Court discretion under Art. 226 to dismiss writ petition in limine only if frivolous, vexatious or prima facie unjust; otherwise entitled to hearing on merits
precedents.cited_holding: if a party claims to be aggrieved by the unlawful, arbitrary or unjust order of a public body or authority, he is entitled to a hearing of his petition on merits and the High Court will number be justified in dismissing such a petition in limine.

precedents.citation: M s Exen Industries The Chief Controller of Imports and Exports and others 1

anchor.surface_text: Following the above decision in M s Exen Industries The Chief Controller of Imports and Exports and others 1 , Mitter J., speaking for the Court set aside the order of the High Court dismissing the writ petition in limine with the following observations However the High Court though companypetent to decline to exercise its extraordinary jurisdiction under Art. 226 of the Constitution when it finds that the petition is frivolous or without substance should number throw it out in limine if a prima facie cage for investigation is made out.

precedents.case_name: Exen Industries v. Chief Controller of Imports and Exports
precedents.cited_proposition: High Court should not dismiss writ petition in limine if prima facie case for investigation made out
precedents.cited_holding: the High Court though companypetent to decline to exercise its extraordinary jurisdiction under Art. 226 of the Constitution when it finds that the petition is frivolous or without substance should number throw it out in limine if a prima facie cage for investigation is made out.
